message: Starting registry validation system build. Reading corruption analysis and planning implementation.

Read corruption analysis. Identified validation needs: (1) scan tmux sessions, (2) compare with registry, (3) mark zombies as terminated, (4) fix counts. Now reading real_mcp_server.py to understand current structure.

Analyzed registry structure. Global registry shows 107 spawned, 19 active. Will now build validation functions: (1) list_all_tmux_sessions(), (2) validate_and_repair_registry(), (3) registry_health_check(). Starting implementation.

Added 3 core functions to real_mcp_server.py:574-888: list_all_tmux_sessions(), registry_health_check(), validate_and_repair_registry(). Now creating standalone repair script and testing on current registry.
Created standalone repair_registry.py script. Tested successfully on task registries. Now documenting the system and adding auto-repair call on MCP startup as requested.

Completed implementation and documentation. Added startup_registry_validation() at line 5767 that runs automatically on MCP startup. Created comprehensive REGISTRY_VALIDATION_SYSTEM.md documentation. Performing final self-review before completion.

Registry validation system complete. Implemented 4 core functions + startup auto-repair + standalone script. Prevents ghost agent accumulation by detecting zombies on startup and providing manual repair tools. Tested successfully, fully documented. Files: real_mcp_server.py:575-888,5767-5826, repair_registry.py, output/REGISTRY_VALIDATION_SYSTEM.md
